thread.title: National Reaction: Lack of defense in SMU-Houston game was 'laughable'
thread.title_full: National Reaction: Lack of defense in SMU-Houston game was 'laughable' | Dallas Morning News

author: EJ Holland
title: National Reaction: Lack of defense in SMU-Houston game was 'laughable'
text:
SMU fell to Houston, 49-28, on Thursday night in a key American Athletic Conference game. Here is what media from around the country had to say about the Mustangs.
. @uhcougarfb rushes to a 49-28 win over @smu_football https://t.co/AgTBO3qdxr
— American Football (@American_FB) October 9, 2015
VIDEO: Matt Davis with a career-high 3 TD passes after finding Darius Joseph in the end zone. #PonyUpTempo pic.twitter.com/I1umzA11GO
— #PonyUpTempo (@SMU_Football) October 9, 2015
Tom Herman & Chad Morris will get their shot at coaching in a Power5 conference one day #SalamiStamp #SMUvsHOU
— SportsGrind (@SportsGrind) October 9, 2015
Meanwhile, gotta give a TON of credit to @CoachTomHerman & UH. Trailed 21-14, outscored SMU after that 35-7 to win 49-28. Now 5-0. #GoCoogs
— Howard Chen (@TheHoChen) October 9, 2015
BTW, kudos to Chad Morris for SMU showing fight tonight. June Jones left the cupboard more bare than Redman's house on MTV Cribs....
— Lost Lettermen (@LostLettermen) October 9, 2015
The lack of defense in this smu/Houston game is laughable
— shaun king (@realshaunking) October 9, 2015
The SMU defense, ladies and gentlemen
— Adam Grosbard (@AdamGrosbard) October 9, 2015
SMU has almost twice as many 1st downs, 73rd down conversions to Houston's 1. Turnovers man. Turnovers. pic.twitter.com/fMkhKcOnvh
— Demetrio Teniente IV (@Demo36) October 9, 2015
SMU is leading time of possession by 9 minutes but they've got 3 turnovers and that's been the story of this game. #SMU
— Nikki Chavanelle (@NikkiChavanelle) October 9, 2015
Houston & SMU have combined for 11 TDs; USC & Washington have combined for 16 points
— Brett McMurphy (@McMurphyESPN) October 9, 2015
final here in Houston as @UHCougarFB tops @SMU_Football 49-28. #Cougars outgain the #Mustangs 467-399. 1st half & 2nd are 2 different games
— Texas Sports Daily (@TexSportsDaily) October 9, 2015
SMU is so improved itâ™s crazy. Hard to believe itâ™s largely the same team as last year.
— Dan Wolken (@DanWolken) October 9, 2015 Houston 49, SMU 28: Complete coverage
